headline: Southern Linc and Georgia State Agencies Celebrate Interoperability Project with Ceremony at the Capitol
summary: Southern Linc, a subsidiary of Southern Company (NYSE: SO), joined multiple State of Georgia agencies and Gov. Brian P. Kemp to celebrate completion of the Georgia Statewide Communications Interoperability Project during a recent meeting at the Capitol. Gov. Kemp was commended for leading a statewide initiative to unify the disparate radio systems of first responders, law enforcement and government agencies, enabling them to operate as a cohesive unit and force multipliers in emergency situation

content.title: Southern Linc and Georgia State Agencies Celebrate Interoperability Project with Ceremony at the Capitol
content.summary: Southern Linc, a subsidiary of Southern Company (NYSE: SO), joined multiple State of Georgia agencies and Gov. Brian P. Kemp to celebrate completion of the Georgia Statewide Communications Interoperability Project during a recent meeting at the Capitol. Gov. Kemp was commended for leading a statewide initiative to unify the disparate radio systems of first responders, law enforcement and government agencies, enabling them to operate as a cohesive unit and force multipliers in emergency situation

thumbnail.caption: Representatives of Georgia State Patrol, Georgia Department of Natural Resources, Georgia Forestry Commission, Department of Homeland Security and the Georgia Emergency Management Agency joined the Southern Linc team in recognizing Governor Brian Kemp for his support of the Georgia Statewide Communications Interoperability Project. The project brought state, regional and nationwide MCPTT communication capability to agencies through interoperability with Southern Linc’s CriticalLinc™ LTE network.

headline: Switched Source Furthers Commercial Readiness With Georgia Phase-EQ™ Installation
summary: CHICAGO, October 01, 2025--As the U.S. prioritizes reliable grid infrastructure and affordable energy, the need for cost-efficient grid solutions has never been greater. Switched Source, a leading developer of grid-enhancing technologies, today announced the successful deployment of its Phase-EQ technology in Macon, Ga. content.title: Switched Source Furthers Commercial Readiness With Georgia Phase-EQ™ Installation
content.summary: CHICAGO, October 01, 2025--As the U.S. prioritizes reliable grid infrastructure and affordable energy, the need for cost-efficient grid solutions has never been greater. Switched Source, a leading developer of grid-enhancing technologies, today announced the successful deployment of its Phase-EQ technology in Macon, Ga. Southern Company, through its subsidiary Georgia Power, served as an early demonstration partner, offering site access, engineering input, and operational data to evaluate the te

thumbnail.caption: Utility and project partners recently visited the Macon site to see the Phase-EQ installation firsthand.
